intro: Cumbata villosa, commonly known as the hairy cumbata, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves with a velvety texture. It produces showy, pink to reddish flowers that bloom in clusters. Cumbata villosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
